thread.title: Algeria: 100 Firms Expected At Next International Building Show in Oran
thread.title_full: Algeria: 100 Firms Expected At Next International Building Show in Oran

title: Algeria: 100 Firms Expected At Next International Building Show in Oran
text:
Algeria: Charter for Peace and National Reconciliation - Report On Its Implementation to Be Submitted to President This Week 
Oran — Up to one hundred Algerian and foreign companies are expected to take part in the 6th International Building and Urban Management Show (Oran Expo BTPH) next October, in Oran (432km west of Algiers), organizers said. 
The show will run from 12 to 15 October at Mohamed Benahmed Convention Centre, with the confirmed participation of about one hundred domestic and foreign companies, some of which are from Spain, France and Italy, the show's communication officer, Tarek Messaoudene, told APS. 
The economic event is meant to "shed light on the government's development programmes in building industry, and which also include basic infrastructure projects and industrial firm upgrading." 
The show, according to the source, will be an opportunity to "make further known the potential of building industry in Algeria, while offering various opportunities for promotion of exchanges and business relations at the international level." 
Some 7,000 professional visitors are expected to the economic event, organized by GMR Events Algeria, in partnership with many bodies, such as the National Agency for Investment Development (ANDI, Algeria) and the Chamber of Commerce and Industry - Marseille Provence (CCIMP, France). Algeria
